intro: Vincetoxicum schimperi, commonly known as the African bittersweet, is a flowering plant native to regions of Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, orange, or yellow. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, and its leaves are usually opposite and oval in shape. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrubland habitats.
